_pattern.value: Business version of the diagnostic report

resource.value: An explicitly assigned identifier of a variation of the content in the DiagnosticReport

_pattern.value: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the diagnostic report when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the diagnostic report author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

resource.value: An explicitly assigned identifier of a variation of the content in the DiagnosticReport.

_pattern.value: There may be different diagnostic reports that have the same url but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the diagnostic report with the format. The version SHOULD NOT contain a '#' - see [Business Version](resource.html#bv-format).

resource.value: While each resource, including the DiagnosticReport itself, has its own version identifier, this is a formal identifier for the logical version of the DiagnosticReport as a whole. It would remain constant if the resources were moved to a new server, and all got new individual resource versions, for example.
